Course Summary

Get ready for the AP Calculus BC exam by reviewing the lessons and quizzes in this helpful test preparation course. Our learning materials are accessible on your mobile phone or tablet at any time, so you can study at your convenience.

About This Course

College-level calculus review could not be easier than we make it here. The video lessons in this AP Calculus BC exam preparation course are designed to give you brief lessons on everything differential, integral and polynomial to boost your performance in class and on the exam. Our expert instructors have taught mathematics for years, and the videos come with engaging and memorable graphics to help you remember key topics. Take the self-assessments after each lesson and chapter to gauge your performance in that subject area.

Check out our AP test prep materials! We've got AP courses to teach you the material, comprehensive AP study guides to help you study, AP practice tests to test your knowledge, and informational AP resources to get you up to speed on testing logistics.

Syllabus & Course Information

This course covers the types of calculus topics that you'll likely encounter on the day of your AP test. As you work through the course, you'll review essential calculus formulas and improve your problem-solving skills. By the end of the course, you should be able to:

  • Evaluate the continuity of functions
  • Solve problems involving parametric, vector and polar functions
  • Analyze Taylor series
  • Approximate definite integrals
  • Graph functions
  • Find the limits of functions
  • Outline derivative properties, applications and points
  • Define the fundamental theorem of calculus
  • Identify second derivatives
  • Understand logarithms and exponentials
  • Work with scientific calculators for calculus
  • Use polynomials and exponents
  • Analyze series and sequences
  • Use integration techniques

Course Format

Sectioned into 23 chapters, this course's 160 lessons offer a quick way to improve your calculus knowledge and skills. The lessons come with printable transcripts, as well as short quizzes that help you retain key concepts. We've also included an Ask the Expert feature that you can use if you have any questions about calculus.

AP Calculus BC Exam Information

Students who have taken the AP Calculus BC course in high school will have to sit for the course's standardized assessment. Passing the AP exam can help you earn credit and placement for college.

  • Approximate Number of Questions: 51
  • Question Types: Multiple-choice and free-response
  • Time Limit: 3 hours and 15 minutes
  • Exam Cost: $94
